rComments: Only had 6 assignments (& a final presentation), but there was always plenty of time to turn them in. His grading criteria was clear & he repeatedly talked about what he wanted from assignments in class (I always went to class even though it wasn't mandatory & lecture slides were online). I also never did the readings. Do the work, easy A.

Dr. Skardon is an overall good professor. The class I took we had to write a case study about a topic of our choosing and he was very helpful. The work is difficult because it requires long hours of researching and writing. But if you try your best he will see that and help you out or extend the  due date. My study was 50 pages, so be ready

Dr. Skardon was clear on the goals and expectations of his class. He gives all assignments in a respective amount of time with clarity on exactly what's expected from the assignment. He has a very well rounded amount of experience and knowledge with startups. I loved his class and would suggest other students take it as well.

John is a sort-of funny guy. Maybe it's because it's a 2-unit course, but I wasn't too into the class. Workload is not overwhelming. I never did ANY of the readings. The lectures are endless and not all that interesting, but he does bring in entrepreneurs that help you if you are really interested in launching a business. It was alright!
Professor Skardon is probably one of the most intelligent people in the department when it comes to business and Tech Information. He actually knows how to teach unlike some teachers at UCSC

Had him Spring  2013. At times  a boring class but he's great guy. Has an amazing background and knows the subject at heart to provide real knowledge of the topic in the real world. Businesses Cases were fun as a were in groups and not difficult at all. Skardon does great as a first Tim class as was mine, would recommend to a friend.

A very dull professor teaching a particularly dry subject was not a good combination.  Tests were poorly written, this class was a joke.  The only redeeming part of this class was the weekly business case studies.  Other than that this class is a waste of time.

This was John's first class at UCSC. His background is legit and his lectures are pretty interesting. Our class used to be really quiet and now a lot more people participate. He engages with students and he provides a lot of resources for the class. Graders are easy on papers. Tests were not that well written, but this was his first class.
